articles.title: Depression Underdiagnosed in India for Adults - MD Magazine
articles.description: The investigators found the overall age-standardized prevalence of depression based on the CIDI-SF scale was 5.7%, significantly higher than the self-reported rate of 0.5%.
articles.content:
Depression rates among adults are substantially higher in India than self-reported rates indicate, according to new research.

articles.title: Exceeding Exercise Guidelines Boosts Survival, to a Point - Medscape
articles.description: A large US study found a sweet spot at roughly twice current physical activity guidelines but no added mortality reduction or harm after a certain threshold.
